page.title: 07THE RAILWAY.
page.content: A branch line from Leuchars to St.Andrews was opened on July 1st 1852.It was run by the Edinburgh,Perth and Dundee Railway Company.The station was on flat land beside the links.In 1887 St.Andrews was connected with the existing East of Fife Railway and a new station was built nearer the town in a cutting.The old (Links) station became the Goods station. The line was always single track and a condition of the sale of the land across the Strathtyrum Estate was that no trains should run on Sundays. The last train on the East of Fife line left St.Andrews on 6th.September 1964. The St.Andrews to Leuchars line closed on 4th.January 1969. The Goods station was demolished to make room for the Old Course Hotel. Only the station master's house survives and is now the Jigger Inn.
